content:
Diagnosis:		Melanoma, right posterior shoulder

Management:		Wide local excision with 2cm margins and sentinel lymph node biopsy 15 Apr 2024

Histology:		Breslow 2.8mm, no ulceration, no lymphovascular invasion
		Sentinel nodes negative (0/2)
		KIT D816V mutation positive

Current situation:	Cycle 2 adjuvant pembrolizumab

[redacted name] attended the melanoma clinic today for review prior to cycle 2 pembrolizumab. The first cycle was well tolerated with only grade 1 fatigue lasting 48 hours. No immune-related adverse events have occurred. The surgical site continues to heal well with no concerning features. Blood tests today show normal thyroid function, renal function and liver function. Performance status remains 0. We will proceed with cycle 2 today and arrange routine imaging prior to cycle 4. Next review in 3 weeks with blood tests.

primary_cancer.histopathology_status: Melanoma, Breslow 2.8mm, no ulceration, no lymphovascular invasion

cancer_timeline.value: Wide local excision with 2cm margins and sentinel lymph node biopsy, nodes negative (0/2)

patient_facts.value: Surgical site healing well with no concerning features
Normal thyroid function, renal function and liver function

status_updates.value: Stage T3aN0M0 melanoma post surgery, tolerating adjuvant pembrolizumab well with no significant toxicity
Grade 1 fatigue lasting 48 hours after first cycle, no immune-related adverse events
Review in 3 weeks with blood tests
